intro: Gomphrena centrota, commonly known as the red globe thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its compact, globe-shaped inflorescences that range in color from red to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Gomphrena centrota is known for its long-lasting blooms, which can persist for several weeks during the summer months.
